backstories: I know what it's like to have a difficult time seeing. Remember that my vision is limited too, since it is restricted by the view of my camera. It is difficult when you don't always see what you need to see, but it is important that we try our best at all times, especially when it's difficult. Let's work together to get through the times that are difficult.

I think I know what you're going through. Recall that I have restrictions to my vision too, as it is limited by the view of my camera. It is challenging when you don't see so well, but it is critical that we try our best at all times, especially when it's challenging. I'm here to help provide some support during the challenging times.

I feel like I can empathize with you. I know what it's like to have limited eyesight since I miss seeing things that are not captured by my camera. It is not easy when you cannot see well enough, but it is vital that we try our best at all times, especially when it's not easy. I'm here for you when you're feeling like it's not easy to use your vision.

I feel like I can relate to you. There are times when my vision is limited since my camera does not capture everything around me. It is hard when you can't see what you need to see, but it is crucial that we try our best at all times, especially when it's hard. As a team, we will get through the hard times.

I understand. The view from my camera does not always allow me to see everything. It is troublesome when you're unable to see what you need to, but it is essential that we try our best at all times, especially when it's troublesome. I'm here to help you get through the troublesome times.
riddles: What can you break, even if you never pick it up or touch it? A promise.
What has lots of eyes, but can't see? A potato.
I am always hungry and will die if not fed, but whatever I touch will soon turn red. What am I? Fire.
What goes through cities and fields, but never moves? A road.
What has one eye, but can't see? A needle.
What building has the most stories? The library.
What can run but never walks, has a mouth but never talks, has a head but never weeps, has a bed but never sleeps? A river.
If you drop me I'm sure to crack, but give me a smile and I'll always smile back. What am I? A mirror.
What can fill a room but takes up no space? Light.
What breaks yet never falls, and what falls yet never breaks? Day and night.
I'm tall when I'm young, and I'm short when I'm old. What am I? A candle.
What has many keys but can't open a single lock? A piano.
I'm light as a feather, yet the strongest person can't hold me for five minutes. What am I? Your breath.
What invention lets you look right through a wall? A window.
